page.title: 08FACILITIES AT THE HOSPITAL.
page.content: The hospital will have three wards with a total of 72 beds. Provision has been made in the planning for the building of a fourth ward if that should become necessary. There is also to be a day unit which will have 40 places. It is expected that the majority of patients will be elderly although it will be possible for minor, non-surgical patients to be treated here instead of at the large hospital five miles away. These patients will be under the care of their local G.P. instead of a hospital doctor. There will be no Accident and Emergency Unit, all urgent cases being dealt with at the Chesterfield Royal Hospital as before.
